result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Titus Tyra Jr. in court in person, in custody.  Attorney Jack T Eichorst on behalf of Attorney Alicia H Kort in court in person for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Status of Counsel. Defendant appears without representation. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court orders a new date be set to give SPD more time. Matter is adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Christopher Titus Tyra Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court with Christopher Titus Tyra Jr.  Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Matter in court for Doctors report return.

The defendant is requesting new counsel.  Court GRANTS the request.

Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Arguments heard as to bail.   State request bail be set at $50,000.00.  The defendant request a low case bail.  Court orders bail set at $30,000.00, with TURN OVER TO JUSTICEPOINT, for level 5 monitoring, GPS, 24hour curfew, No contact with the victim or the victim' s family.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

JUDGE HAVAS BRANCH 10 for JUDGE WATTS BRANCH 15.
State v. Lee Hearing held.  Argument heard as to appointment of counsel.  Court will leave case scheduled for preliminary hearing and allow additional time for public defenders office to appoint counsel.

Defendant Christopher Titus Tyra not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with NAW, TKP, CAW
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision LEVEL 5.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Christopher Titus Tyra in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Christopher Titus Tyra in custody.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Titus Tyra appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
